body: Catherine Sbordone spent yesterday running around her cozy home in the Gravesend section of Brooklyn collecting items she usually takes for granted: a nail clipper, sunscreen, toothpicks, safety pins and a deck of cards. A week ago, her husband Donald's Army National Guard unit, based in the Williamsburg section, was called to active duty. And
title: Call of Gulf Duty Echoes In a Home in Brooklyn

body: Fred Allegretti, the head of a large New York heating oil delivery company, follows daily oil trading on the computer screen behind his desk. The ever-changing numbers directly influence the wholesale price he pays for oil and, in turn, what he ends up charging his customers. He doesn't like what he sees on his screen and his customers don't like
title: An Oil Dealer's Niche: The Man in the Middle

body: LEAD: A Brooklyn man was swept out to sea Friday night when he tried to save another man and their drunken friends hindered police rescuers, officers said. body: LEAD: May link recalls her first trolley rides to Manhattan Beach with her mother in 1912. body: LEAD: Three men wearing ski masks took more than $500,000 from a Brooklyn bank yesterday in what the police described as one of the largest bank robberies in recent memory.
